title-of-article: Sony Global - Diversity & Inclusion | REPORT | SCA, SIE, SEL and SPE - all Earns Perfect Score on LGBTQ Workplace Equality
content:
Human Rights Campaign Corporate Equality Index

SPE Earns 100% on Corporate Equality Index 7th Year in a Row

We're excited to announce that Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE) has earned a perfect score of 100 on the 2020 Corporate Equality Index (CEI), the premier U.S. benchmarking survey and report on corporate policies and practices related to LGBTQ workplace equality. SPE has scored 100% since the first year the company applied in 2013.

Administered by the Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Foundation, the 2020 CEI evaluates LGBTQ-related policies and practices including non-discriminatory workplace protections, domestic partner benefits, transgender-inclusive health care benefits, competency programs, and public engagement with the LGBTQ community. SPE's efforts in satisfying all of the CEI's criteria results in a 100 percent ranking and the designation as a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ Equality.

Stacy Green, Sony Pictures Entertainment Executive Vice President and Chief People Officer commented: “We are proud that Sony Pictures is a company deeply committed to fostering an inclusive culture in which all employees can thrive. It is an honor to have our long term effort and commitment with respect to LGBTQ equality be recognized with a 100% Corporate Equality Index Score – and look forward to continuing to challenge ourselves to meet and exceed the expectations of our phenomenal people.”

This year, SPE joined the ranks of 686 major U.S. businesses -- including Sony Corporation of America, Sony Electronics, and Sony Interactive Entertainment —all of which also garnered a 100 percent ranking.

For more information on the 2020 Corporate Equality Index, or to download a free copy of the report, visit.

We are proud to announce that Sony Corporation of America (SCA) has received a perfect score of 100 percent on the Human Rights Campaign 2020 Corporate Equality Index (CEI), making us a Best Place to Work for LGBTQ equality. SCA has earned top marks since the first year the company filed in 2016.Administered by the Human Rights Campaign Foundation, the CEI is a national benchmarking survey and report on corporate policies and practices related to lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer (LGBTQ) workplace equality. This year, SCA joined the ranks of 686 major U.S. businesses—including Sony Interactive Entertainment, Sony North America and Sony Pictures Entertainment—that also garnered top marks.As a Company, Sony promotes diversity by ensuring an inclusive work environment, and by recruiting, hiring, training and promoting employees from diverse backgrounds. At SCA, we support the LGBTQ community through sponsorship of The Trevor Project (the leading national non-profit organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ youth) and Sanctuary for Families (a non-profit organization dedicated to aiding victims of domestic violence and related forms of gender violence), and through the great work of OutLoud, LGBTQ-inclusive Employee Business Resource Group.The 2020 CEI rated 1,059 U.S. businesses in the report, which evaluates LGBTQ-related policies and practices including non-discrimination workplace protections, domestic partner benefits, transgender-inclusive health care benefits, competency programs, and public engagement with the LGBTQ community.For more information on the 2020 Corporate Equality Index, or to download a free copy of the report, visit.Please visit Sony.net for more information on ,Sony’s diversity practices.
